program: Master of Engineering Management (MEM) – Thayer & Tuck

sections.text: The MEM program integrates engineering and business training to prepare leaders who can manage technology-driven organizations.

items: Core in management, operations, and technology
sections.text: The program combines engineering, management, and business coursework with applied project experience.

items: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, or physical sciences
Relevant professional or research experience recommended
sections.text: Applicants should demonstrate technical undergraduate preparation and interest in technology management.
Graduates assume leadership roles at the intersection of engineering, technology, and business.
